p: Approximately 36 BALB/c mice (6–8 weeks old, female) were divided into 6 groups: A, B, C, D, E, and F, 6 mice pre group. Four days after infection, each mouse was placed into a whole body plethysmography chamber (EMKA, France) and was nebulized first with PBS then with increasing doses (3.125, 6.25, 12.5, 25, and 50 mg/ml) of methacholine for 3 minutes for each nebulization; the mice were allowed to rest for 2 minutes, which was followed by the measurement of the breathing parameters for 5 minutes after each nebulization to determine the Pehn values.
